critical_changes.current_state: 3 academic term(s) lack explicit definitions or visual supports
critical_changes.proposed_change: Add explicit definitions with examples or visual supports for all academic terms
critical_changes.rationale: Students reading 2-3 years below grade level need explicit vocabulary instruction with multiple representations
critical_changes.impact_if_not_addressed: Alex will struggle to understand tier 2/3 vocabulary: bias, reliability, perspective

bias.definition: A personal preference or prejudice that affects how someone views information
bias.example: A soldier writing a letter home might show bias toward his own side in the war

reliability.definition: How trustworthy or accurate a source of information is
reliability.example: A diary entry written on the day of an event is more reliable than a story told years later

perspective.definition: The particular way someone sees or understands a situation based on their position and experiences
perspective.example: A Union soldier and a Confederate soldier would have different perspectives on the same battle

critical_changes.current_state: Activity 'Document Analysis Practice': Writing task lacks sentence frames or model responses
critical_changes.proposed_change: Add sentence frames and/or worked example
critical_changes.rationale: Struggling writers need explicit models showing how to structure academic responses
critical_changes.impact_if_not_addressed: Alex may freeze when attempting to produce academic writing without structural support

sentence_frames: The speaker of this document is _____ because _____.
The audience for this document was _____ because _____.
The purpose of this document was to _____ (persuade/inform/entertain).
Evidence from the document that supports my thinking is: _____.
